website_summaries.verdict: A powerful oven for camping and tailgating, but you'll be baby-sitting the temperature whenever you use it.
pros: Comes with two 7,500 BTU burners and a 3,000 BTU two-rack oven
Oven is capable of temperatures up to 400 degrees Fahrenheit
Runs off a 1-pound propane can (five hours at high heat), or you can buy an adapter to use a 20-pound tank
cons: Takes up quite a bit of space
Temperature is a little difficult to keep consistent
Some reports that the oven window arrives broken or breaks easily

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive outdoor back yard kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make an outdoor kitchen on my lanai. It is perfect! It lights every time. I can fit 2 full sized skillets on the burners (bacon and eggs for the family) and i have used the far to bake a cake, cinnamon rolls, and meatloaf...it keeps me from heating up my house in the summer. I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.text: This stove is good quality and a good value. Gets plenty hot up to 450 degrees. Well done Camp Chef.
customer_reviews.author: Scott and Rachel

customer_reviews.title: A must have 🍪
customer_reviews.text: Cooked chicken enchiladas like a champ for its first meal. Tailgating and camping in style we love her.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Ridders

customer_reviews.title: Not efficient or reliable
customer_reviews.text: Temp control is horrible. Highly recommend you take extra propane as it will burn three 1 green cylinder every 30 or so minutes. Faster if you use oven. Also take a lighter since the auto light works only when it wants. I also recommend you buy a new regulator for when your new one goes out. It is light weight and a great concept but has a few failures they need to work out.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten F.

customer_reviews.title: The quality is respectable
customer_reviews.text: Oven on low stabilizes at 400 degrees in patio breeze. Higher with no breeze. Too hot for many a 'fire&forget' cowboy casserole. Otherwise a fine piece of kit that should last quite a few seasons with proper care and maintenance. Brass caps are purrdy. Recommend a 20 - 30 minute burn off prior to use. We did 20 minutes...or until we no longer smelled something other than heat. A bin liner and shipping peanuts equals the optional 'oven bag', said the oven bag owner. Also recommend a 20lb tank adapter hose for more than 2 days/nights cooking for 3. Don't forget this is a terrific back up for power-outage situations.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Worked once :/
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and now i can’t get the oven to turn on :/
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Sadly I can't rate this item; if I could I would rate it a minus 5.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the order was cancelled, but not until *after* I had already been shipped (and paid for) the adapter to use with the Oven to connect it to a larger propane tank. The adapter is totally useless to me without the Camp Chef Oven. Very upset about that needless expense, not to mention not getting the item I wanted and ordered. Now I have the adapter kit but nothing to "adapt". The Camp Chef ovens now available are considerably more expensive, yet are the exact same product. Something smells very fishy to me.
customer_reviews.author: JHH

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, doesn’t work even after they sent us replacement ignition part.
customer_reviews.text: Never has worked right. First the lighting mechanism didn’t work and they sent me another that I had to install, which was a chore. Oven still didn’t work with the small propane canister. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Big bird

customer_reviews.title: Great stove, just dont use top burners on full and try to light oven.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, hooked it up to a big bottle and tried it out. Everything worked, though I found that stove would not stay lit until I turned the top burners down to medium/low settings. Apparently not enough gas is left over in the small lines to feed all 3 burners at once on full power. Stove heats up to 350 degrees in aprx. 5 minutes. twice as fast as my gas home oven.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This oven performed quite well. We were able to cook frozen pizza, and bake cinnamon rolls (the ones from the tube) and a few other things with no problem. The set up was easy, and it seems to be economical on propane. The stove top has plenty of room for a couple of 10 inch frying pans so breakfast was a breeze. This is a heavy oven, but it seems well constructed. I bought an Amazon Warehouse one with a few dings and dents, but they came out easy enough and none affected the performance of the oven. Hopefully I won't have to in the near future, but I would buy another one of these ovens.
customer_reviews.author: Spudwiggley

customer_reviews.title: great camper van oven
customer_reviews.text: What a great little (on the outside) oven/cooktop. I have mounted it in the doorway of a vw bay window van and it is a perfect fit. We will have turkey for thanksgiving this year at REDROCKS, Az. Best part is you can put it on a picnic table if it is to hot to cook inside.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Moore Jr.

customer_reviews.title: only black cookies
customer_reviews.text: We nicknamed the oven on this thing the burninator. It has two temperatures Burning hot and cremate. Otherwise it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Scott Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Good Oven/Stove
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stove if you do a lot of camping. We use it exclusively in our camp kitchen unless rain forces us to remain in our 12x20 foot tent. Then we haul out the little Coleman. You have great control of both the oven and the eyes. But, get the cover and the long hose for the 20 lb tank. You'll run through those little propane bottles. (Oh...we live in hurricane territory. We've used it inside with open window when the power was out after a storm.)
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing for long hunting trips!
customer_reviews.text: My friends and I take this with us on week long hunting trips. It's large enough for two medium pans on the top burners and the flame is magnificent. The oven is slightly slow to warm as you'd expect with the surface area, but it'll get the job done with a small cast iron pan to make biscuits and gravy. (Essential for my hunting buddies). Sturdy and surpisingly well designed. Lasts about 4 hours with the burners and oven going on a 1LB propane bottle. Defintely upped our camp kitchen game to be able to take premade food from home and cook it in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T McMicken

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: works pretty well. Can't really use the two burners and oven at the same time because it draws to much from the oven for it to stay at max temp. Temp gauge broke within days but we replaced it with a cheap thermometer on the inside. Other than that it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R Landino

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping or an outdoor kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: I saved camping as a bucket list item for later in life. I'm that woman in her 40s who hasn't been camping. I went what can only be described as "glamping" this weekend and this baby had a lot to do with it. This stove is amazing. I am in the process of installing an outdoor kitchen and this will be perfect for it. We used it to make steak and breakfast and both were perfect! I would recommend using an oven thermometer as the temperature will vary a bit. Cooking is a non issue but I imagine baking would be a little bit of a challenge in windy conditions. I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle L Tiller

customer_reviews.title: Some good some bad
customer_reviews.text: The good: It has a sturdy glass front so you can see what’s happening in the oven. It’s light and has carry handles. The bad: Oven starter does not work so I have to use a lighter. No thermostat so adjusting the Oven temperature is a learning process of trial and error by opening the door a crack or wider to modulate the temperature. This is not ideal because the knobs of the oven and stove top get baking hot. The stainless steel surround is very thin and mine arrived with a small dent which could have only happened in the packaging process because the box was intact on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cooking Value
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this stove/oven in an outdoor kitchen for almost 2 years now and it is working perfectly. We have higher BTU Camp Chef cookers for projects that require larger boiling capacity, but the value of this stove/oven is hard to beat. There isn't much that can't be cooked and all you need are some smaller sized (9x11) cookie sheets and/or cast iron pans. An added benefit is the unit is designed so that the majority of the external heat is vented upward, which means it can be used in close quarters. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast
customer_reviews.text: Oven runs hot, even on low it hits 400+ and on high 600+ using the built int temp gauge, will probably check against another thermometer soon, other than that a great addition to our camping equipment. Great heat out of the top burners, can’t really simmer on low, gets pretty hot fast, but that’s ok cause you can make dinner fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazinghank

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there
customer_reviews.text: Awesome but the built-in thermometer is not even close. I bought a little oven thermometer to sit inside, now it's perfect. FYI: You cannot just set the temperature and cook with this oven however after you use it a couple times you'll see where the dial needs to be to get those temps you need, i.e. 325 degrees F etc.
customer_reviews.author: Laketime

customer_reviews.title: Oven works good
customer_reviews.text: Oven works very well. Baked a cake that cooked evenly and tasted great. Enchiladas and lasagna did just fine too. Have not tried the stove bc I got it for the oven only. 2 negatives: can't use in rain, (duh!) and you must watch it. I checked mine every 5 minutes and had issues getting the temp to go down once up. Had it on lowest setting and it was still tinkering around 375. Very nice looking, and serves its purpose. Also, we had to get a hose converter for a 10g propane tank in order to use, be careful, the 1st one we got was incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: Damaged1

customer_reviews.title: Good cabin oven
customer_reviews.text: My family and I live in a off-grid cabin and use this as our kitchen oven. I bought the hose adapter and hooked to a 20 LBS propane bottle outside. We are using this inside. Great burners that are easy to control and adjusts down real low! The oven is a little tricky at first, since this unit has no thermostat. I’ve found that once you get the oven lite, keep on high until it reaches 300 degrees, then turn it all the way down to low. This should keep temperature at 400. To cool it down you must open door for about 10 seconds. Overall very nice looking and working. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Super Tube

customer_reviews.title: as long as you dont expect it to be like your kitchen oven its okay.
customer_reviews.text: some things you might want to know, the temperature control is not like a kitchen oven where it holds a temperature, you just set it to hi and hope for the best. it seems to max out at about 375 degrees, and if there is any breeze you wont even get that. as long as you are okay with those limitations this might be okay for you. the burners on top work good though.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great bug out stove or for camping
customer_reviews.text: No mechanical issues so far. Only recommendation is to get an oven thermometer to put inside when baking; the mounted one is off about 15 degrees. Aside from that it works perfectly. Works well in a slight steady breeze also. I would recommend purchasing the pans and sheets that fit inside the oven. Your standard household pans etc. will not fit. Purchase the regulator/adaptor to hook up to your regular grill propane tank and you can cook for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: several issues
customer_reviews.text: The temp gauge is not even close to working right. After three uses the one igniter quit. Will not get over 325 degrees Want to email company or someone to possible swap it out for another to see if its just this one I like the unit but not living up to what I read or saw one line.
customer_reviews.author: stephen jansen

customer_reviews.title: Second one
customer_reviews.text: My first camp chef lasted 8 years in our outdoor kitchen. The best purchase we made for our tiny home. Really great for small spaces. Can make a roasted chicken, baked whole fish, biscuits, and cookies. Will purchase over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Sands

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. It is very efficient. The only problem I had is the temperature gauge for the oven is never correct. I use an infared thermometer to read the temperature of the oven instead. They shipped us a replacement gauge and it does the same thing. I think the problem is the placement of prob. Other than that I would have give it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Tena R Wisner

customer_reviews.title: Oven wouldn’t get hotter then 250
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd camp chef oven first worked great for years then it wouldn’t stay lite changed out what was suggested no help decided it was just too old purchased another one now I cannot get oven over 250 very disappointed any help or suggestion would be appreciated
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: Over all review, LOVED IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Some things to consider. 1. It is a "little" heavy so make sure you put on something that will take the heat and weight. 2. When using the oven, make sure you watch the temp. It will run hot if you just let it go. 3. You may want to purchase the hose adapter and a longer hose to run it off of a larger tank. Once you are used to the oven this setup is FANTASTIC!! If your power ever goes out you have a backup stove and oven ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Why heat the inside of your RV
customer_reviews.text: This little unit is great for cooking and baking when camping, especially for not heating the inside of your RV in the summer. The oven is a little small, a 1/4 sheet cake pan fits just fine, but 1/8 sheet cake pans work even better. I have baked biscuits, pizza, and cakes with great success. The stove top is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Tom A Willis

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous to have on hand in case of an emergency!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting one of these for a long time to have on hand for an emergency. We got the adapter hose to hook up to a larger container of gas and the handy bag to store it in, too. Earthquake? We'll be the envy of the neighborhood!
customer_reviews.author: Artsycalgal

customer_reviews.title: Great Outdoor Oven
customer_reviews.text: We love outdoor cooking and have used this little oven for over 6 years. From french bread pizzas to homemade biscuits, you can do it all. It takes a little practice to control the heat just the way you want it but every oven takes a little getting used to in my experience. Nothing like a hot cup of fresh ground coffee with our gravy and biscuits to start the day!
customer_reviews.author: rz2

customer_reviews.title: Great after I adjusted the temperature gauge!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, now it works great! I sent the 1st unit back, and the 2nd unit didn’t work any better. I called campfire and the offered to send me a new temperature gauge. I received the gauge and saw that it was adjustable. I adjusted it, and now it works fine. The temperature was way off it would read 600 and be 350 or 400!! So I was under cooking trying to get it down to 350!! A little work, well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: lester

customer_reviews.title: Damaged camping stove
customer_reviews.text: Second camping oven came in with a dented lid. First one had broken door glass. I can live with the dentd one but I feel I should be compensated. If I have to send it back so be it then I will cancel the order and expect a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Saari

customer_reviews.title: Propane leaking from the regulator on the back of oven
customer_reviews.text: It worked alright when it was working but now propane is leaking from the regulator on the back of the unit and I cannot find a replacement part. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Bluevision

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Camp Chef oven and stove top and I absolutely have loved both of them! I had the first one for five years and finally decided to splurge and buy a new one. The new one has an extra shelf inside, which makes it even more perfect than my first one! I can roast a whole chicken, pot roast, my award-winning winning beef stew and more. It’s actually my kitchen, as I live in Hawaii with kitchens are generally outside. The only additional cooking item I have is a grill
customer_reviews.author: maryelleninhawaii

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used this oven once when we took it camping right after we got it, but it worked perfect! We hooked ours up to our RV and baked biscuits and cornbread. Bakes as good as my oven at home! Great investment. We will be taking this every time we go camping! It is very easy to use and figure out the temperature. I had no problems at all! It is a tad heavy but it is larger than I was expecting. Love everything though!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: outstanding  camping oven
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a warehouse deal to save a few bucks...that worked great.... have used it 6 or 7 times so far and I could not be more impressed with the quality and the functionality. the outdoor portability was a big selling point for me....as the old saying goes..."u can cook a dog turd outside and make it taste good."
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Combo Stove and Overn
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to buy one of these for years, one thing I realized about camping alot, is that you need to sometimes reheat or simply bake something in an overn. The camp chef outdoor camp oven is built to last, very strong, and light. If you camp alot, get one of these before they go up in price again, I got mine with a discount when I singed up for the AMAZON Credit Card. Best deal ever.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Van Life!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a Sprinter van and this is the most amazing camp stove ever! I have cooked everything from cakes to salmon fillets to chili. The oven sometimes has a little trouble turning on, but I find holding it in longer before sparking seems to do the trick. I’ve been using this stove as my full time cooking device for 8 months now and I am definitely a happy camper. Highly recommend!! Such a great little stove for a stellar price! I will buy it again when mine dies.
customer_reviews.author: Ren Q

customer_reviews.title: Nice outdoor stove
customer_reviews.text: It is nice outside stove, I needed for my deck. The oven bakes slowly, but I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: maya tsanova

customer_reviews.title: Glad i bought this. It was well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Love this this I use it all the time in my apartment to save on electricity. A 1lb canister can cook 4 meals with this. In my opinion you can't go wrong with it. I've had this product for 5 months now and its still working great you can cook anything in the oven and on the cook top cleaning is really easy as well
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven/stove combination and had great expectations as to it’s functionality and boy were my expectations met or exceeded! The two 7500 BTU cook top burners lit very easily and perform very well. The oven was more difficult to light, but with practice, that process became easier. The 3500 BTU oven burner heats up quickly, but the oven temperature gauge isn’t terribly accurate, however, I anticipated this and had a second thermometer to check it. My first attempt at baking was a total success as was my second. As advertised, the cooktop was easy to clean. Overall I am extremely pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Fredric W. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for camping or off grid use!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE TO ORIGINAL REVIEW-- First, this oven has been great for cooking. I purchased a 2nd one because flames started to shoot out back of old one and I tossed it. Welllll....here we are again with the same issue on 2nd one. Camp chef seems to have a regulator issue with these stoves that causes propane to leak out regulator, and finding a replacement part has proven difficult. This oven is anazing! I purchased it to use in b our off grid farmstead. It works like a charm. We use it daily, and it's propane consumption is minimal. ...we use a small 5 gallon tank, and it last about 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: Off-grid momma

customer_reviews.title: Good service, shaky product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and received it with a dent on the side, presumably from handling conditions. Requested for an exchange and I received a brand, new oven in 2 days without it costing me any extra! Stovetop works perfect and is amazing to use, but the oven starter doesn’t ignite the oven! You must manually light it with a lighter or manual starter. I would exchange it again for one that works but couldn’t because I needed it immediately for camping. 5 stars for service, 2.5 for effectiveness
customer_reviews.author: GERARDO DANIEL GRASSO

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I made for my off gird build.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely ever write a review on products. However, this was the best purchase I made when I was building my off grid, container home. I have used this oven to bake cookies, oven dishes, muffins and more. I have used this with single propane tanks and with a 20lb. I am writing this review almost 3 years later and I am about to buy another one to go into my next build. If you are on the fence about buying this, don't be. This is an awesome purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Season P.

customer_reviews.title: I love
customer_reviews.text: When people see that I have an oven in my van, their mind flips a little bit. They probably think I'm roughing it where I go, but, ha! I'm living the fancy life where I'm at because I can make biscuits and gravy, pizza, and roast a whole chicken. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Chaunceylock

customer_reviews.title: Great oven!
customer_reviews.text: Great oven. Cleans up super easy. Works amazingly!! Only one small issue. After a few uses, the right side igniter doesn't work. Overall a great oven. Compact and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: the over is very workable and it cleans up pretty easily. Love it on camping trips and can ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over a year - and can't complain a bit. Heats quickly, the over is very workable and it cleans up pretty easily. Love it on camping trips and can even use it when the home oven is stuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I use it nearly every day. The door on the oven has a bit of an issue though but I've solved it with the heavy duty magnet from a computer hard drive. Seems that the spring isn't strong enough to draw the door completely back. I use an adjustable regulator so I can get the oven hot a lot quicker. Other than that the thing is great I love it
customer_reviews.author: francis randall

customer_reviews.title: Best camping stove and oven ever!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on Sunday, arrived Wed! We also bought the carry case - you need it. We are thrilled as it arrived just in time for our trip. Burners actually burn hotter than any camp stove we have had yet, and the flame is easily adjusted. The oven worked great! The oven quickly heats up to a high temp, so start at lower temp then adjust. Made a casserole and baked biscuits twice and all turned out perfect. We have wanted this stove for over a year and was glad to find it at a greatly reduced price.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Johns

customer_reviews.title: Purchased and used this product on 3 camping trips, ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and used this product on 3 camping trips, one of them was 2 weeks long. Appears well built and it lights well. The only complaint I have is that it is impossible to regulate the temperature in the oven. Even on the lowest setting, the oven gets to more than 475 degrees if you leave the door closed. I was able to pseudo manage the temp by propping the door open with a knife or spatula. It was still worth it to have the ability to bake or hold warm items while cooking the rest of the meal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using It in my ourdoor kitchen on the pool deck
customer_reviews.text: Really like this stove and oven. Small enough to take camping. Big enough to cook a pizza in it. And, love it that it is used in my outside kitchen on the pool deck. Helps keep the house cooler by not using the oven inside. I'll have pictures of it in the outside kitchen once I am finished with making the perfect spot for it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Great Oven
customer_reviews.text: Love this little oven. We use this on the front porch of our one room, no accessory hunting cabin in upstate NY. Even in the dead of winter it maintains consistent heat. We purchased with the adapter to hook up to a propane tank. Works 100% better than the oven in our mobile home and can fit soooo much more. Real size trays.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Buying used can save a chunk of change!
customer_reviews.text: It will be a bit of time before I can test this stove out but, I'm pretty freaking excited about it! I purchased this stove used at $100 less than a brand new one. As you can see in the photos, there is only very minor flaws. It's Amazon inspected and certified. If you can look passed a few scratches and dings, I highly recommend buying what is left of the used stock.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing, temp not accurate
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this stove! We installed it in our van kitchen and my husband was skeptical that it would be enough to replace having a toaster oven. We have used it almost every day for the last 2 months and have not yet gone through our 20lb tank. It gets really hot, really fast but our only issue is that the oven rack has too large of gaps. Pizza, toast, and anything not on a pan just falls through the cracks. The temperature gauge is also not accurate but it still gets pretty darn hot. Recommended for anyone living in a van or just for avid campers who want to step their food game up.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Was able to cook muffins, pizza, and cookies ...
customer_reviews.text: Was able to cook muffins, pizza, and cookies in the wilderness. Between baking and using the stovetop to cook breakfast for 4 days, still did not run through a full 16.4 oz propane cylinder. It is fairly difficult to regulate the temperature, but I can put up with that for the luxury of being able to bake cookies in the woods. The only bummer is that one of the stovetop self-igniters isn't functional which I didn't realize until after 30 days--too late for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: mgerber

customer_reviews.title: I Want One!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite possession for 2016! I conduct a cooking workshop for the Dept of Parks and Rec for the City. I can cook full meals in the middle of a park if need be. The participants are amazed when I take chicken off the grill, put in a pan and stick the pan in the oven then later serve it to them hot! I am asked for my recipes and where I bought my stove. When the workshop is over I pack it in the case, stick it in the back of my Element and eas on down the road.
customer_reviews.author: BB2Tutor

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We took this camping in the.mountains. It worked great! We made blueberry muffins and cornbread muffins. Takes a little linger to cook, but worked great! The stove worked wonderful too. Had absolutely no problems at all. Just make sure to get the case. Makes toting it alot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: **WARNING  BOOK WILL CATCH FIRE **
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this oven ! But DO NOT TRUST THE BUILT-IN TEMPERATURE GAUGE ! BUY ONE TO hang inside. Also REMOVE THE BURNER HEAT SHIELD A BOOK IS HIDDEN RIGHT OVER THE BURNER AND WILL CATCH FIRE !!!! OURS DID !!! I really enjoy this oven, it is Wonderful ! 😀
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, functional, portable Stove/Oven
customer_reviews.text: Stove top does not go low enough to simmer. Fortunately my thick copper bottom pots hold a lot of heat, so I can just cycle on/off until desired consistency is achieved. Oven works great and I have not had issues with it being too hot; as others have commented about.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome. We camp all the time and I am ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. We camp all the time and I am stuck in the hot camper cooking for everyone. Not any more. We set this up down by the table and I can be a part of things. We cooked a tri-tip roast dinner with seasoned potatoes and sourdough bread for 20 on our last camping trip. Also great for cinnamon rolls in the morning. We discovered it was very useful when the power went out for 3 days due to wind storms.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnna L. Prichard

customer_reviews.title: Has couple issues but are easly fixed
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. the temp gage is not right had to buy one to stick in the oven. Does great making biscuits just need to turn pan around mid way during cooking. The back cooks faster than the front . Need to run a small bottle of fuel thru it before using to burn the new smell off. We use it alot and couldnt do without it. Gotta have my biscuits and chocolate gravy every morning. Happy camping
customer_reviews.author: Turnip Green

customer_reviews.title: and offer really nice controllable burners
customer_reviews.text: Picked this unit up for dirtbike camping trips and it has exceeded every expectation. Not only did it hold heat well, bake foods perfectly, and offer really nice controllable burners, the inside stays hot and the outside remains pretty cool to the touch! So much so that I was able to enclose it in some home made cabinets and just leave it there. This has been the best addition to an already extensive list of camping gear, and it has turned our weekends away into opportunities to show off our camp-cooking skills!
customer_reviews.author: SandFleaDDH

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Love this oven......however I didn’t open it up till we were camping. Package was not damaged but this is how it was in box. I hate that I paid that much for it and it looks like this.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: a must have if you cook!
customer_reviews.text: it didnt light but Campchef was great in helping us tighten things up. this campoven spoils us. great for tailgating, emergencies, camping. we lice it and cook everything in it.
customer_reviews.author: terryw

customer_reviews.title: Burns food , oven unpredictable,  parts hard to find
customer_reviews.text: The temp gauge is off by 50 - 100 degrees. It will read 400+ but its more in the range of 375 - ...good luck trying to find a regulator when you need a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: ASTN

customer_reviews.title: Pleased scouts
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for our boy scout troop. We used over the weekend and worked great. Easy to set up and use. The oven was a hit. Made biscuits 😋. Only thing is it hard to maintain proper temp in the oven if you are using the burner at the same time if you are using the small one pound tank; but overall well Pleased scouts
customer_reviews.author: Chuck marley

customer_reviews.title: Love this camp stove
customer_reviews.text: Love this camp stove, bakes brownies, muffins, etc. Able to keep food warm while cooking rest of meal. Temperature is a little hard to regulate, and you definitely want to use a 20lb tank, the small tanks will work but it goes through them, wonderful design, good craftsmanship
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: He loved it! It’s pretty heavy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for his birthday after seeing one in a store. He loved it! It’s pretty heavy, but looks and feels sturdy and like it is great quality. It will be perfect for camping trips. It fits a good sized casserole dish in it, but pan size is still something we’ll have to keep in mind when preparing our make ahead camping meals.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful oven and the stove kicks
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful oven and the stove kicks. I recommend a pizza stone for the oven to stabalize the temp. I can bake cookies with mine without burning the bottoms. Would habe given 5 stars but the feet fell off after 5 months and no way to screw back on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for any emergency/camping.
customer_reviews.text: Thinking of emergencycamping supplies? You need this. I would not get caught without it.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo da Vinci

customer_reviews.title: A great little stove and oven!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! I saw this little fella and instantly thought cool a preparedness ready item. It works GREAT!! I have purchased the 20lb tank conversion hose assembly to use in our basement with good ventilation to and from it. It does hit just shy of 425 on hi for the oven setting and controlling the oven temp is a bit tricky, best to start low and mark the dial at certain temps as you increase the heat. Other than that it is just like a home gas stove and oven and works PERFECT!! I encourage anyone looking for a stove-oven for home or camping or that just in case we fall apart to get this little guy! GREAT PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Randy G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice outdoor oven/burner system.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. You'll want to get the valve assembly to allow for using standard 20# gas bottles though. Small cannisters don't provide enough flow for 2 burners, and the oven. With the optional valve - this is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: So nice to bake outside without heating the rv up
customer_reviews.text: The burners light automatically. The only thing we didn’t like was when we ordered a hose to hook it to a large propane tank we looked the part up under accessories and we were sent the wrong part. It was for the camp chef grill not the oven
customer_reviews.author: brezesauntie

customer_reviews.title: Love,  Love LOVE this combo
customer_reviews.text: I love this combo. It works well, is easy to use and I'll never go camping without it. It also came in very handy when my home oven died. Got me through until we got the new oven. I literally could live with this as my oily stove/oven. Love, Love LOVE this.
customer_reviews.author: d e

customer_reviews.title: Super Great Quality & Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This item is incredible! I use it inside my van conversion. It’s really well made and there’s not been anything I can’t cook on/in it, that I cooked on my Bosch oven and stove that was in my sticks and bricks. I bought a oven temp to put inside the oven to give me a more accurate temp.
customer_reviews.author: SoloTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Great OutDoor Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I love camping and yes I do have a travel trailer, but I prefer to cook outside, weather permitting. I have tried at least 15 or 20 different stoves through the years, but this is the 1st one I've bought that fulfills all the requirements of camping, The oven works beautifully I have baked, biscuits, cakes, pie, pizza, scalloped potatoes, roast, etc. The top burners are excellent for a 2 burner grill for making breakfast or just general cooking. I highly recommend this product to those who like to camp.
customer_reviews.author: DrakIII

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great camp stove, gets hot enough to cook anything well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with performance
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with performance. Seems to cook a little cooler than thermometer reading as my first baking attempt took longer than recipe directions. With experience I can adjust to how it cooks. The oven holds heat well and cooks evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy camper 😏
customer_reviews.text: Positives-Nice looking product and seems to be well made. The top stove works well. Negatives-The oven is an impossible challenge to regulate the temperature (I tried and tried😵) Food cooks WAY to fast and the oven seems hotter at the bottom than top so food easily burns on the bottom of pans. Very dissapointed as this product really can't cook like an oven and for the price I paid it should😢
customer_reviews.author: Angela Outen

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: works well once you get use to it. It starts to heat up to quickly at first for the oven. Once you put what you are cooking in it it cools down and does a very good job. i found the temp gauge to be incorrect. So I picked up an oven gauge which works well. Quite nice if the power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Widmann

customer_reviews.title: Great! Truly a essential for every home or camp!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, works well ! Be sure to get designated Camp Chef cover, much easier to handle and protects stove. Also LPG extension line and 20# cylinder if you do a lot of cooking. No more worry’s when storms or other events take out Electric, my family eats none-the-less. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this quite a bit. Oven is a little small, but i am single and works for me. Not to heavy to move around. I plan on ordering the cover for it. 3 hour roast and still a good amount of fuel left in canister. wish it was set up to broil so i could make toast in it.
customer_reviews.author: Phils Deal

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camp Oven.
customer_reviews.text: I love my little camp stove. I have it in my cabin and use it a lot. My only complaint is that the oven is difficult to regulate. Even on low I have to crack the door open a little to keep it from going over 350 degrees. It is a little easier to regulate the temp if it is colder in the room. I have learned to rotate pans around when baking brownies or cookies so they don't burn on the bottom. I got some nice pans at the discount store that fit perfect. It is also pretty easy to clean. You won't be sorry if you purchase this. The price is right compared to places like Gander Mountain.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit and finish. Nicer burners then my RV stove top. Low simmer. Baked bread in the oven. Great for an RVers, when it's to hot to cook inside.
customer_reviews.author: ArtStream

customer_reviews.title: Installed in Sprinter van
customer_reviews.text: We bought this oven/stove combination to install in our converted Sprinter van. Originally, we weren't going to install something with an oven... but I'm glad we did! We've used the oven every time we've taken the Sprinter out for a weekend/trip. This was one of the best purchases we made for our Sprinter van conversion!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie D

customer_reviews.title: Our son and daughter-in-law LOVE it, so much so that we will now ...
customer_reviews.text: oops - I reviewed this under "Cover". This was the HIT of Christmas. Our son and daughter-in-law LOVE it, so much so that we will now be buying one for our other 3 kids and their spouses! Do be sure to buy the Cover though. We also bought the Dutch Oven to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Banana

customer_reviews.title: It works but is not like a full size.
customer_reviews.text: The grates over the burners are my favorite thing about this stove. They are heavy and large in size. I can cook in any sized pot or skillet. The oven is awesome in that is is large but I am still not sure as to how to set it. I will get familiar with how to set the temperature as I continue to use it. There is no gauge to go by. All in all I would recommend this little stove and oven, if asked. It was a good purchase. No regrets. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: The Artist

customer_reviews.title: I have now owned this for 6 years. TONS ...
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned this for 6 years. TONS of use and I swear by it. Had a knob break, but that was with rough handling while harsh mountain camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Green

customer_reviews.title: Love this stove/oven
customer_reviews.text: Since we have frequent power outages, we bought this Camp Chef oven/stove as our emergency backup system. Set up was really easy and with the camp table, the combination will more than take care of our needs. Although some of the reviews mentioned inadeqate handles for lifting, the manufacturer resolved this with easy to grasp handles on both ends. In addition, another review mentioned the oven temperature guage would get in the way, that guage is permanently mounted on the front panel with the burner and oven controls. Works like a charm and I love have the flexibility with the oven feature in addition to the burners.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanny

customer_reviews.title: it takes a little while for oven to heat up, and takes a little longer to cook, but great
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product. it might take a little longer to cook, but your camping, right? your suppost to be relaxing anyway!
customer_reviews.author: becky fox

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stove. Oven cooks very well and 1 small bottle ran both burners and oven for almost 4 meals.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C

customer_reviews.title: important thing to know about this oven is level by the inside baking racks not the outside.
customer_reviews.text: Roasted chicken and brownie muffins. The oven should be levelled according to the inside rack not the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this.
customer_reviews.text: Our annual whitewater trip in Maine means I'm feeding more than 30 people for 4 days. This oven saved me a lot of work and let me do things I couldn't before. It adds two more burners to my kitchen but most importantly, an oven! Instead of scrambling or frying eggs for breakfast, I just bake a big pan of fritattas which cook in the oven while I fry the bacon and homefries. I can also bake potatoes, mac'n'cheese for the kids and corn bread. I'm even going to get a second one for this year's rafting trip in August. You'll love this - I promise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: we tested it to see that there were no problems during the shipment and it arrived in perfect condition, the oven and burners worked very well
customer_reviews.text: We bought the stove for the hurricane season, we tested it to see that there were no problems during the shipment and it arrived in perfect condition, the oven and burners worked very well, it does not need phosphorus since it turns on when the button is turned to turn on the stove. a push and turn and turn on, very good stove
customer_reviews.author: GRF

customer_reviews.title: Super 2 burner stove and oven.
customer_reviews.text: Light, big burners, great oven, and can use small or large propane bottle. I baked a cake and made 2 dishes on burners, all at the same time with just a 1 lb propane bottle. Super camping/survival cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Nutritionist

customer_reviews.title: Great oven
customer_reviews.text: Great ,first time I used it was March the 15th we went to Wales West in Foley Alabama, works perfect , just what I wanted was able to cook biscuits and cinnamon rolls and chocolate chip cookies for a camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and very handy.
customer_reviews.text: Great value and very handy to have on hand . Came in very handy when we lost power in a snow storm. Don’t forget to buy the hose adapter for the big propane tank. With it you are set for anything from camping to tailgating to power outages.
customer_reviews.author: Lost husband

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set up for not a lot more money than ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set up for not a lot more money than the typical stove top unit. We cook biscuits for breakfast and even some frozen butterflied shrimp. Takes a few minutes to get hot and I would recommend the bbq or larger bottle with adapter hose but come on, we have an oven anywhere we want. Easily worth the couple extra parts.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

product_meta.title: Camp Chef Outdoor Camp Oven
product_meta.description: DECENT FEATURES of the Camp Chef Outdoor Camp Oven Two 7,500 BTU brass range burners Oven output: 3,000 BTU (heats up to 400° F) Insulated, efficient oven box and 2 oven racks Matchless ignition Stainless steel body Built-in oven temperature gauge Oven fits 9 x 13 pan inside Powered by a disposable 1 lb propane bottle, can be adapted for use with standard bulk tanks Ready to cook out of the box The SPECS Box Dimension: (L x W x H): 24.5 x 16 x 21" Box Weight: 37 lbs
feature_bullets: Matchless Ignition - use 1lb propane tank - can be adapted to use 20lb tank
Stainless steel construction - 7,500 BTU's per burner, Oven 3,000 BTU's
Nonstick enamel cooking surface - Top oven heat: 400 degrees
Oven thermometer and two oven racks
Inside Oven dimensions W 16" x H 8.5" x L 10 - weight 35 lbs

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
